00193 Uns32 bhmGetDiagnosticLevel(void);
00194 
00196 #define BHM_DIAG_MASK_LOW(_diag)        ((_diag & 3) > 0)
00197 #define BHM_DIAG_MASK_MEDIUM(_diag)     ((_diag & 3) > 1)
00198 #define BHM_DIAG_MASK_HIGH(_diag)       ((_diag & 3) > 2)
00199 
00201 #define BHM_DIAG_MASK_SEMIHOST(_diag)   ((_diag >> 2) & 3)
00202 
00206 #define BHM_DIAG_LOW     (BHM_DIAG_MASK_LOW(bhmGetDiagnosticLevel()))
00207 #define BHM_DIAG_MEDIUM  (BHM_DIAG_MASK_MEDIUM(bhmGetDiagnosticLevel()))
00208 #define BHM_DIAG_HIGH    (BHM_DIAG_MASK_HIGH(bhmGetDiagnosticLevel()))
00209

00324 typedef enum bhmSaveRestoreStatusE {
00325     BHM_SRS_ERROR,      
00326     BHM_SRS_OK,         
00327     BHM_SRS_END_LIST    
00328 } bhmSaveRestoreStatus;
00329 
00331 
00332 #define BHM_SAVE_VAR(_NAME) \
00333     bhmSave(#_NAME, &(_NAME), sizeof(_NAME))
00334 #define BHM_RESTORE_VAR(_NAME) \
00335     bhmRestore(#_NAME, &(_NAME), sizeof(_NAME))
00336

00360 
00361 // Save a list element using the active save context. Pass NULL to value to
00362 // indicate the last element of the list
00368 
00369 bhmSaveRestoreStatus bhmSaveElement(
00370     const char *elementName,
00371     const char *endName,
00372     const void *value,
00373     Uns32       bytes
00374 );
00375 
00376 // Restore a list element using the active restore context. The return value
00377 // is BHM_SRS_OK if an element is successfully restored, or BHM_SRS_END_LIST if
00378 // the list terminator has been read.
00384 
00385 bhmSaveRestoreStatus bhmRestoreElement(
00386     const char *elementName,
00387     const char *endName,
00388     void       *value,
00389     Uns32       bytes
00390 );

00473 Int32 bhmSerOpenAuto(void);
00474 
00481 #define BHM_SER_OPEN_AUTO_FORMALS \
00482     { .name = "console",            .type = ppm_PT_BOOL,   .description = "If specified, port number is ignored, and a console pops up automatically" }, \
00483     { .name = "portnum",            .type = ppm_PT_UNS32,  .description = "If set, listen on this port. If set to zero, allocate a port from the pool and listen on that." }, \
00484     { .name = "infile",             .type = ppm_PT_STRING, .description = "Name of file to use for device source" }, \
00485     { .name = "outfile",            .type = ppm_PT_STRING, .description = "Name of file to write device output" }, \
00486     { .name = "portFile",           .type = ppm_PT_STRING, .description = "If portnum was specified as zero, write the port number to this file when it's known" }, \
00487     { .name = "log",                .type = ppm_PT_BOOL,   .description = "If specified, serial output will go to simulator log" }, \
00488     { .name = "finishOnDisconnect", .type = ppm_PT_BOOL,   .description = "If set, disconnecting the port will cause the simulation to finish" }
00489 
00496 #define BHM_RECORD_REPLAY_FORMALS \
00497     { .name = "record",   .type = ppm_PT_STRING, .description = "Record external events into this file" }, \
00498     { .name = "replay",   .type = ppm_PT_STRING, .description = "Replay external events from this file" }
